revised_title: The Holt-Waters: Nature, Virtues, and Medical Applications
tldr: The author, John Lewis, describes the Holt-Waters' nature and virtues, attributing their effectiveness to their attenuating, astringent, and drying properties. These properties make them a valuable treatment for scorbutic and scrophulous cases, as well as other illnesses. The waters are also considered a noble diuretic, helping remove obstructions from the kidneys and promoting renal gland secretions.
